comment.author: 77191617@N03
comment._content: Are you certain that this is a group of Masons?  Don't the Knights of Columbanus; Ancient Order of Hibernians, and suchlike wear similar collars and aprons? (Not to mention the Loyal Orange Order; KKK and so on!) The robes and Christian symbolism seem overtly religious for the Masonic Order.

comment.author: 59842170@N00
comment._content: Would say the gents at the back left with the apron are a dead giveaway for the Masonic Order! The cape with cross is called: 'Knights Beneficent of the Holy City'. The gauntlets ie cuffs around the wrist: 'Craft Officer Gauntlets'. The gent third row fifth from left with the fab walrus moustache has the masonic symbols of compass and carpenters square hanging from a chain around his neck! Masonic Lodge for certain. There is even a website which sells this gear nowadays!!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/77191617@N03] Fairly certain, yes. And [http://www.flickr.com/photos/rockface] there are a few websites - couldn't believe the range when I was checking out "Aprons", etc.
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
